data.text: @ariehkovler Nope - I’ve been there. After significant COVID exposure, I felt mildly ill. Part of me hoped it was COVID just to get it over with. But I never tested positive. (On the plus side, I learned the vax works really well for me & my fam.)
@ariehkovler Feeling that way today. Pretty sure it's just a bad head cold. Had negative home test. Will try again tomorrow to be sure. Welcome back to colds, flus, and other viruses in circulation.
@ariehkovler You may be right, but in that case why is it a "waste"?
@ariehkovler I was feeling crappy a few weeks ago and had a Covid and Strep test done, it was Strep, not Covid. It was bad. Took a full two weeks to recover with antibiotics.

@ariehkovler Take another test tomorrow. My husband was + last Wednesday but mine was -. I didn’t feel as bad as him, but something was going on. Got a very faint + the next morning. His + lines have been darker & more immediate than mine. He’s still + and I’ve been - since Saturday.

@ariehkovler I felt the same two weeks ago. But I just keep in mind two 3x vaxed friends who got covid at Xmas and are still off work with long covid - exhaustion, brain fog, chest pains (and both were active gym members, before someone asks about health!). So, still want to avoid covid.
@ariehkovler Oh. You... you have a storm coming. It’s just one year of endless day care crud though! It tapers off!
@ariehkovler Children are a blessing, but also tiny disease bags
